title: Compliance Internship
content:
About us 





Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 5,000,000 active users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.
Over 30,000 global brands and small businesses, including H&M, Adidas, IKEA, SHEIN, noon, and Bloomingdale’s, use Tabby’s technology to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering flexible payments online and in stores. Tabby is active in Saudi Arabia, UAE, Egypt and Kuwait and backed by leading investors, including Sequoia Capital India, STV, PayPal Ventures, Mubadala Investment Capital, Arbor Ventures and others.






 About the role:
We’re looking for a compliance internship candidate who can support the implementation of the Compliance & AML/CFT program aimed at ensuring adherence with regulatory requirements. The internship extends to 6 months and offers a fast-tracked way to gain the necessary knowledge and skills required to excel in regulatory compliance.
You’ll be working in a dynamic, rapidly evolving environment with the following responsibilities:

Create and manage internal logs, registers and department databases
Create, maintain and update internal trackers
Support on compliance reviews carried out on internal departments
Assist in developing policies and procedures to ensure aligning policies and procedures with regulatory requirements 
Apply the day-to-day operations assigned by the department head. 
Conduct ad-hoc reviews to ensure that internal controls are working as expected. 
Perform Sanctions and AML/CFT investigations. 
Draft and assist in filing Suspicious Transactions Reports (STRs) with the FIU. 
Support on internal/external reporting requirements including periodic reports to the regulator and internal quarterly reports

You should apply if you are:

Adaptable and quick learner
Proactive and self-motivated individual
Innovative, creative with problem solving skills 
Outstanding in written/verbal english communication skills
Able to manage multiple streams of work independently
Tech Savvy, skilled in MS office and particularly excel and word
What you can expect

We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in company’s employee stock options program.
Health Insurance

We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow and meet their goals (whatever they may be).
If this sounds exciting to you, we’d love to hear from you!

questions.label: Why do you want to join Tabby?
What languages are you fluent in?
What are your key strengths that you will bring to the role?
What do you hope to gain from this opportunity?
Please confirm you're a Saudi national
When can you start the programme?
The internship is in Riyadh, are you currently living in riyadh, or willing to relocate for the role
